env.name: TRAEFIK_RULE
env.description: Traefik rule (https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/v3.0/routing/routers/#rule)
env.label: Traefik rule

env.name: POSTFIX_HOSTNAME
env.description: Important to not get into spam boxes.
env.label: Postfix hostname

env.name: HTTP_PORT
env.description: Local webserver port for testing and development
env.label: Http local port. (default=autoselect)

templates.title: Wordpress vanilla
templates.note: Do not forget to install redis plugin. See stack editor for more info.

env.name: TRAEFIK_RULE
env.description: Traefik rule (https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/v3.0/routing/routers/#rule)
env.label: Traefik rule

env.name: MYSQL_PORT
env.description: Local MySql port for management (connect via ssh to localhost on this port with your sql manager)
env.label: MySql local port. (default=autoselect)

env.name: HTTP_PORT
env.description: Local webserver port for testing and development
env.label: Http local port. (default=autoselect)

env.name: GULP_PORT
env.description: Local gulp development port
env.label: Gulp local port, only when dev profile is enabled. (default=autoselect)

env.name: COMPOSE_PROFILES
env.description: Which services to enable: dev=development (gulp), db=database
env.label: Profile list

templates.title: Wordpress litespeed
templates.note:
You'll have to unpack and install wordpress yourself.

Do not forget to install redis and litespeed plugins. See stack editor for more info.
